results.title: Sleep
results.brief_description: Talks about what sleep is; why we need it; what happens to the body during sleep. It makes parallels between human and animal sleep. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Slavery and slave resistance
results.creator_credit: Dynamic Films, Perspective Films and Maurice Barf
results.brief_description: Conducted by a young African American youth speaking from a graphic display of artifacts, historical documents, newspapers and pictures, the film traces the origins of slavery and examines the basis of racial stereotyping as it developed in the dehumanising conditions of slave life and work.

results.title: Slave hunter = Rancheador
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC) and Sergio Giral
results.brief_description: Against the historic backdrop of the colonial slave era in the Caribbean and other parts of Latin America, the figure of the Rancheador (slave hunter) appeared as one of the most abominable exponents of the system. The Rancheador, the mercenary of his era, was in charge of hunting down runaway slaves, the cimarrones, and returning them to their owners, or if the hunt ended in death, bringing back the slave’s ear. Francisco Estevez, one of the bloodiest and most ambitious slave hunters in Cuban history, was hired by the rich landowners to police the interests of absentee sugar growers. This film is based on the diary of Estevez himself, who not only hunted down the runaway slaves in their palenques (communities concealed in the hills, made up of runaway slaves), but also used his henchmen to repress all outbursts of rebellion or desire for freedom of those either white or black, free or slave. ‘Rancheador’ is the second film of Giral’s Slave Trilogy that also includes ‘The Other Francisco’ (1974) and ‘Maluala’ (1979). Adapted from ‘Diary of a Rancheador’ by Villaverde. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Slaughter at speed
results.brief_description: Shows some attempts to find solutions to the problem of death on the roads. The slaughter in cars, buses, trucks and other vehicles which move on the roads follow an hourly predictable pattern. Discusses American and British research in discovering what happens when a car crashes and how best to keep the people inside it alive - or to prevent the crash ever occurring.

results.title: Sladke hry minuleho leta = Sweet games of last summer
results.brief_description:
This impressionistic adaptation of De Maupassant’s classic novel ‘Mouche’ about a laundress and her five suitors was made for Czech television. Slovak-born director Juraj Herz has a career in film and television that spans more than 35 years and 30 films, working mainly in Prague but also in Slovakia, Germany and France. Although he first came to prominence in the 1960s, his work stands apart from that of other Czech and Slovak New Wave directors in its willingness to cross genres and constitutes a dense exploration of the fantastic.

Credits: Director, Juraj Herz ; photography, Jozef Simoncic.
Cast: Jana Plichtova, Frantisek Velecky, Peter Debnar, Milan Lasica, Julius Satinsky and Lubor Zahon.

results.title: Skyhook
results.brief_description: How the helicopter was used to set up a drilling rig at Sireru in a remote area of Papua. A whole oil camp was lifted piece by piece into the middle of the jungle by helicopter, thus solving one of the biggest problems, that of oil transportation, for in a country with a rainfall of up to 350 inches a year it may take three months to build a road.

results.title: Sky trackers: Family and self
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Margot McDonald, Steve Steve Jodrell and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: Sky trackers is a television series about children, parents and the universe, which combines lively action, strong emotion, high adventure and the cutting edge of science. “Sky trackers: Family and self” includes three stories dealing with human relationships; “Letting go” Mike and his dad are forced to revisit the death of their mother/wife several years ago. “Rocket to me” Nikki and Mike’s complaints about parental demands are dwarfed by the discovery that a friend is subjected to physical and psychological violence. “Origins” Cleo discovers she is adopted and resents her “parents” who have hidden the facts from her. This curriculum package comes with a guide book and is designed for use by teachers of upper primary and junior secondary school (years 5-8).
